result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larron Terrel Lewis appeared by phone.  Attorney April Lande in court for Larron Terrel Lewis. Defendant can hear okay, okay appearing by phone, received no threats/promises to appear by phone. Court finds def KVI waives personal appearance. Court advised defendant was to appear via video. Defendant makes statement. Defendant stipulates to identification. State calls witness, Deputy E. Hernandez, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense examines witness. No further questions, no further witnesses. State filed an information, count tracks that in the complaint.
